alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 12:54PM MST until July 28 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Prescott Metro area and areas southward along State Route 89 in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 PM MST, Doppler radar has indicated that the heavy rain has moved out of the advised area. However, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area as water drains. Between 0.5 and 1.1 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Board Creek, Granite Creek, Agua Fria River, Bannon Creek, Butte Creek, Big Bug Creek, Milk Creek, Hassayampa River, Turkey Creek, Willow Creek, Miller Creek, Lynx Creek, Bottleneck Wash and Wolf Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Oak Knoll Village, Groom Creek Subdivision, Downtown Prescott, Ponderosa Park, Indian Hill West Prescott, Prescott Gateway Mall, White Spar Campground, Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground and Lower Wolf Creek Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 293 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 302 and 319. State Route 89A near mile marker 318. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
